availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William McLane (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1861. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a second sergeant and first sergeant from December 31, 1861 to November 17, 1863. Wounded at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee, on November 14, 1863. Died in Knoxville, Knox County, Tennessee, on November 17, 1863, from wounds received at the Battle of Huff's Ferry.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0266.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 867.
